model

Class Not

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.AbstractOperator
      • model.Not
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Goal, PCExpression

    public class Not
extends AbstractOperator
    This class represents negative clauses. It is a unary operator. It extends AbstractOperator.
    Author:
    Alexandre Camus

    • Method Detail

      • create

        protected AbstractOperator create(ArrayList<Goal> operands)
        Generic constructor of the object. It allows the methods of the abstract class AbstractOperator to create the correct object very easily.
        Specified by:
        create in class AbstractOperator
        See Also:
        AbstractOperator.create(java.util.ArrayList)

      • getSolver

        public NotSolutionNode getSolver(RuleSet rules,
                        SubstitutionSet parentSolution)
        Creates a solver which is a node in the tree proof. This is the version for the not operator.

        This function is recursive over all objects that can be proved and creates the tree of proof for a clause.

        Parameters:
        rules - the RuleSet object containing the rules of knowledge.
        parentSolution - the solution known so far at the parent node.
        Returns:
        the node of the tree of proof.
        See Also:
        Goal.getSolver(RuleSet, SubstitutionSet)

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Returns the negative clause under the form of: "!(operand)".
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        See Also:
        Object.toString()
